title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should give error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error message)
OB: When a file is opened in one editor, there is no warning or error message when trying to open the same file in another editor.
EB: However, there should be a warning or error message displayed when trying to open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Make sure you have associated a Windows editor with your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the java file opened. Close it.
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a java file by simply double clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
4. Right click on the java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.

Expected result:
- A warning message should be displayed stating that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue, or
- An error message should be displayed stating that the file cannot be opened in another editor until it is closed in the workbench.

We believe this behavior is a safety feature where the IDE doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in the IDE.
